news.title: Top Law Firms Fared Surprisingly Well During COVID-19 Pandemic, Survey Says
news.description: Large law firms have weathered the coronavirus outbreak relatively well, with layoffs having been modest thus far, cash collections being up through May, and liquidity being stable.

news.title: Most Law Firms Will Shorten Their Summer Programs and Switch to Virtual Format, NALP Study Says
news.description: Though most law firms will still hold summer programs this year, close to two-thirds of them are cutting those programs to five or six weeks, and over half are using an all-virtual format.

news.title: Majority of Minority Female Lawyers Consider Leaving Law; ABA Study Explains Why
news.description: An ABA report states that seventy percent of women of color who are attorneys leave or consider leaving the legal profession due to challenges including bias and stereotyping.

news.title: Toward Increasing Diversity in Legal Tech
news.description: People of color and women have historically been underrepresented in legal tech, though change can be driven by consumer demand, access to STEM education, and mentoring.
